definition: to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: Field hockey is an outdoor game similar to soccer.
sentences.chinese: 曲棍球是类似于英式足球的户外体育比赛。

sentences.english: Learn the history of the games you enjoy.
sentences.chinese: 了解你所喜欢的体育比赛的历史。

sentences.english: Some orts are co idered to be ectator orts.
sentences.chinese: 有些运动被看作是吸引很多观众的体育比赛。

sentences.english: Usually the "widow" has little interest in the sport themselves.
sentences.chinese: 这些“寡妇”们一般对体育比赛都兴趣不大。

sentences.english: Games have captured the American heart and mind.
sentences.chinese: 体育比赛吸引了美国人的注意力并使之动情。

sentences.english: We love going to high-school and local sports games.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢去高校，参加当地的体育比赛。

sentences.english: However, like a sporting contest, a beauty pageant can also be used to inspire its viewers.
sentences.chinese: 可是，选美比赛也可以像体育比赛一样激励观众。

sentences.english: A: Do you often go to watch sports games?
The next athletics event is the hammer.
sentences.chinese: 下一个体育比赛专案是链球。

definition: abbr. for 奧林匹克運動會|奥林匹克运动会/Olympic Games/the Olympics
